title: Canada proposes to develop robotic lunar rover for Artemis
summary: As Canada celebrates its first astronaut to go to the moon, it is starting a new project that could eventually enable a Canadian to walk on the lunar surface.

title: Report recommends allowing “learning period” for commercial human spaceflight safety regulations to expire
summary: A new report recommends that current restrictions on the FAA’s ability to regulate safety for people flying on commercial spacecraft be allowed to expire later this year.

title: Northrop Grumman developing military communications satellite for 2025 launch
summary: Northrop Grumman is developing a geostationary communications satellite that will compete against a Boeing design in a military procurement estimated to be worth $2.4 billion.

title: NASA sets up Moon to Mars office
summary: As preparations for the Artemis 2 mission ramp up, NASA has established a congressionally mandated office to oversee planning for that and future missions to the moon.

title: New photo reveals extent of Centaur V anomaly explosion [Updated]
summary: "A column of burning, clear hydrogen shot up into a mushroom cloud."

title: What to expect on the day of Starship's Orbital Test Flight
summary: A detailed timeline and expectations of events for the day of Starship's orbital test flight.

title: SpaceX launches Intelsat’s IS-40e high throughput satellite
summary: SpaceX successfully launched Intelsat’s IS-40e communications satellite April 7, which will help the operator meet growing demand for connectivity on planes while also carrying its first hosted payload for NASA.

title: Two recent wargames hold timely lessons for space resilience
summary: A comparison of two recent wargames reveals that the United States’ current course of action to ensure space resilience may not adequately deter and defend against emerging new Chinese space […]

title: SpaceX closing in on first Starship Super Heavy launch
summary: SpaceX offered its strongest signals yet that it is nearing the first full-scale launch of its Starship vehicle, now expected for later this month.

title: Second Axiom Space mission to ISS scheduled for May
summary: Axiom Space’s second private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, commanded by a former NASA astronaut and including two Saudi astronauts, is scheduled to launch as soon as May 8.
